SEARCH
Package model.Memory

Class MemoryStorage

java.lang.Object
model.Memory.MemoryStorage
public class MemoryStorage extends Object

This class is used to keep saved all the Variables and all the AlgorithmComponents used and initalized during the execution of the algorithm created by the user, also manages the connections of the single components when one/more components are being added or deleted from the memory

  • Method Details

    • addComponent

      public void addComponent(AlgorithmComponent c, int index)

      This method adds a component to the ArrayList of components in MemoryStorage in a specific index

      Creates ComponentStart and ComponentEnd and adds them to the MemoryStorage via the ArrayList.add(E e) method

      Parameters:
      c - the component that needs to be added
      index - the position we want the component to be in

      public static MemoryStorage getInstance()

      This method returns the instance of MemoryStorage

      This method creates the instance of MemoryStorage if it doesn't exist and returns it If its already created it returns the instance

      Returns:
      MemoryStorage The instance of the memory

    • addVariable

      public Variable addVariable(Variable var) throws Exceptions

      This method adds a variable to the memory

      This methods adds the variable var to the memory by calling the ArrayList.add(E e) method to the memory, the ArrayList containg all the variables

      Parameters:
      var - the variable that will be added in the memory
      Returns:
      Variable the variable added to the memory
      Throws:
      Exceptions - EXISTING_VARIABLE: If the variable already exists in the memory
      See Also:
      • ArrayList

    • getVariableByName

      public Variable getVariableByName(String name) throws Exceptions

      This method returns a variable obtained with the provided name.

      This methods searches the variable with the name provided to the method by looping through all the variables in the ArrayList in the MemoryStorage, that contains all the variables, if a variable name matches the name provided, it returns the variable

      Parameters:
      name - The name of the requested variable
      Returns:
      Variable the variable found in the memory
      Throws:
      Exceptions - NON_EXISTING_VARIABLE: If the variable doesn't exists in the memory
      See Also:
      • ArrayList

    • addComponent

      public void addComponent(AlgorithmComponent[] components, int index, boolean isSetAddNextComp1)

      This method adds AlgorithmComponents to the memory based on the array of AlgorithmComponent provided as a parameter

      This methods adds the components contained in the components Array to the memory by calling the ArrayList.add(E e) method to the algorithmComponents, the ArrayList containg all the AlgorithmComponents

      If the size components is 3, it means that a ComponentIf is being added, so it also adds a ComponentElse and a ComponentAdd. The ComponentElse and its inner AlgorithmComponents will be the executed if the Condition in the ComponentIf is false. If the Condition it's true, the components following the ComponentIf will be executed. Both the ComponentElse and the ComponentIf last components point to the final component ComponentAdd

      If the size components is 2, it means that a ComponentWhile is being added, so it also adds a ComponentAdd. The ComponentWhile and its inner AlgorithmComponents will be the executed if the Condition in the ComponentIf is true. The last component in the ComponentWhile will point to the final component ComponentAdd

      Parameters:
      components - The Array of algorithm components that needs to be added
      index - The position in which the ComponentIf or ComponentElse is being added
      isSetAddNextComp1 - The boolean flag that will change the way the nextComponent1 of the ComponentIf's ComponentAdd is setted
      See Also:
      • ArrayList
      • AlgorithmComponent
      • ComponentIf
      • ComponentElse
      • ComponentWhile
      • ComponentAdd

    • delete

      public void delete(AlgorithmComponent ac) throws Exceptions

      This method deletes a provided AlgorithmComponent c from the memory and updates the connections of the previous and the next component

      This method deletes a provided AlgorithmComponent c from the memory by calling the method ArrayList.remove(int) and updates the connections of the previous and the next component with the methods AlgorithmComponent.setNextComponent1(AlgorithmComponent) and AlgorithmComponent.setNextComponent2(AlgorithmComponent)

      Parameters:
      ac - The algorithmComponent that will be deleted
      Throws:
      Exceptions - NOT_DELETABLE: If the algorithmComponent ac cannot be deleted
      Exceptions - COMPONENT_NOT_EMPTY: If the algorithmComponent contains inner components

    • containsInput

      public boolean containsInput()

      This method checks if at least one of the components in the array of components its an instanceof ComponentInput

      This method loops through the array of components and checks for each one if its an instance of the ComponentInput class if the condition is met it returns true, if not it returns false

      Returns:
      Boolean the result of the search
      See Also:
      • AlgorithmComponent
      • ComponentInput
      • ArrayList

    • reloadComponents

      public void reloadComponents()

      This method sets the array of components with only the 2 initial components, ComponentStart and ComponentEnd

      This methods clears the array of components with the method ArrayList.clear() and after that sets the initial components by calling the method initializeComponents()

      See Also:
      • ComponentStart
      • ComponentEnd
      • ArrayList
